VIPSPage.PageTitle: HT2011: 22nd ACM Conference on Hypertext and Hypermedia

LayoutNode.Content: Track 3: Social Media (Linking People and Things)

Web 2.0 applications such as social networking platforms, wikis, blogs, and collaborative tools for tagging, voting, commenting, and rating have rapidly gained broad audiences. The reason for their success lies mainly in the fact that no specific skills are required from the participants. The social activity within these systems results in many types of links between people, documents, products, media, concepts, etc. The motivation and interaction patterns behind the usage of social media are of particular research interest. The objective of this track is to gain deeper insights into the world of social media by new ways of analysis and modeling. Research areas like Social Network Analysis, Data Mining, Information Retrieval, Complex Systems, Information Extraction, Natural Language Processing, Semantic Web, Library and Information Sciences, and Hypermedia Systems have been working for a while in this domain. In the HT 2011 track on Social Media, researchers from these and related areas are invited to further advance the state of the art.
LayoutNode.SRC: Web 2.0 applications such as social networking platforms, wikis, blogs, and collaborative tools for tagging, voting, commenting, and rating have rapidly gained broad audiences. The reason for their success lies mainly in the fact that no specific skills are required from the participants. The social activity within these systems results in many types of links between people, documents, products, media, concepts, etc. The motivation and interaction patterns behind the usage of social media are of particular research interest. The objective of this track is to gain deeper insights into the world of social media by new ways of analysis and modeling. Research areas like Social Network Analysis, Data Mining, Information Retrieval, Complex Systems, Information Extraction, Natural Language Processing, Semantic Web, Library and Information Sciences, and Hypermedia Systems have been working for a while in this domain. In the HT 2011 track on Social Media, researchers from these and related areas are invited to further advance the state of the art.

LayoutNode.Content: Topics of interest include but are not limited to:
LayoutNode.SRC: Topics of interest include but are not limited to:

LayoutNode.Content: Analysis and modeling of network structure and dynamics
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Analysis and modeling of network structure and dynamics

LayoutNode.Content: Explicit vs. inferred social links (e.g. mining query logs)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Explicit vs. inferred social links (e.g. mining query logs)

LayoutNode.Content: Co-evolution of social, information, and semantic networks
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Co-evolution of social, information, and semantic networks

LayoutNode.Content: Models of propagation and influence in web 2.0 systems
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Models of propagation and influence in web 2.0 systems

LayoutNode.Content: Models of expertise and trust in web 2.0 systems
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Models of expertise and trust in web 2.0 systems

LayoutNode.Content: Critical mass and incentives for social participation (e.g. games)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Critical mass and incentives for social participation (e.g. games)

LayoutNode.Content: Web 2.0 technologies for recommender systems and personalization
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Web 2.0 technologies for recommender systems and personalization

LayoutNode.Content: Social search, information retrieval in the web 2.0
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Social search, information retrieval in the web 2.0

LayoutNode.Content: Detection and prediction of trends and user behaviour
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Detection and prediction of trends and user behaviour

LayoutNode.Content: Web 2.0 based ontology learning and analysis of emergent semantics
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Web 2.0 based ontology learning and analysis of emergent semantics

LayoutNode.Content: Mapping and visualization of social spaces and networks
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Mapping and visualization of social spaces and networks

LayoutNode.Content: Discovery and prevention of spam, fraud, misuse and other forms of social abuse
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Discovery and prevention of spam, fraud, misuse and other forms of social abuse

LayoutNode.Content: Applications of any of the above methods and technologies
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Applications of any of the above methods and technologies

LayoutNode.Content: We also encourage submissions which relate research results from other areas to the topics of the track.
LayoutNode.SRC: We also encourage submissions which relate research results from other areas to the topics of the track.
